projectPurpose: To provide a fast, intuitive, and efficient terminal-based user interface (TUI) for interacting with Git repositories, simplifying common workflows for users who prefer a keyboard-driven interface within the terminal.
mainFeatures: Stage, unstage, revert and reset files, hunks and lines
Browse and search commit log with diff viewing

alternatives.name: Lazygit
mainFeatures: Single-keypress actions for many Git commands

alternatives.name: Tig
mainFeatures: Supports staging changes at chunk level
Acts as a pager for Git command output

alternatives.name: GitKraken
mainFeatures: Visually appealing graphical interface with commit graph

alternatives.name: GitUp
mainFeatures: Direct interaction with Git database (performance focused)

alternatives.name: Git GUI (git-gui)
mainFeatures: Tcl/Tk based graphical interface included with Git
Focuses on commit generation and amending
Creating branches and performing local merges
Can launch Gitk for history viewing

marketPositioning: Gitui is positioned as a high-performance, terminal-based Git UI written in Rust. It stands out by offering a fast and responsive interactive experience within the command line, particularly excelling with large repositories where graphical GUIs might struggle. It targets developers who prefer to remain in the terminal but desire a more visual workflow for common Git operations than the standard CLI, differentiating itself from both full-featured graphical clients and simpler terminal browsers through its speed, comprehensive TUI features, and keyboard-centric design.
